website_summaries.verdict: Small but mighty, this powerful shredder is perfect for disposing of personal mail, and it fits just about anywhere.
pros: Small enough to keep on your desk
Top handle allows you to easily move and store the shredder
Small bin holds roughly 40 pages of shreds
Teeth can easily shred unopened letters
The shredder also comes with a cleaning tool so you can keep it in good shape
cons: Shredder will only handle small batches of shredding
not ideal for bulk or extended use

customer_reviews.title: This Little Guy Packs a Big Punch!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a shredder at my home to destroy mail. I recently become paranoid about identity left after a special on CNN.. but I digress. This little guy packs a big punch! I have used it to shred whole pieces of mail without even opening them and credit cards. It was able to handle both without any trouble. Due to its small size it isn't great for shredding stacks of paper, so it is better for the once in a while user. I attached some photos to give you a better idea of the size. I give this 5 stars because the manufactures description is spot on and the price-to-value-ratio can’t be beat.
customer_reviews.author: A.K.T.

customer_reviews.title: Quit after 6-7 Uses over 3 Years
customer_reviews.text: Appreciated the small size, but do not appreciate the fact that it quit after 6-7 uses over 3 years. Thought perhaps it had overheated, but next morning it still didn't work. Perhaps the price for a few uses is worth not having to drive paper elsewhere to be shredded, perhaps not. would have re-purchased the tiny shredder I got from Walmart years ago had it been available -- got 17 years' use out of that one & it shredded/cross cutted the paper more finely.
customer_reviews.author: N...

customer_reviews.title: Powerful AND Pretty
customer_reviews.text: This thing is chic and powerful! Two very important things I considered when buying this. I didn’t want something that looked too much like a trash can so when I found this after scrolling several tabs I was instantly compelled to buy- although I was skeptical it would be strong Because there aren’t many reviews. So I’m happy to say it’s SUPER strong. My neighbors has the amazon basics one and I’ve used it- this white Aurora one is slightly less loud and slightly more strong! I can tell it’s higher quality and I love that there is a storage space for the power cord with the divets up top. Buy it you will be happy like me !
customer_reviews.author: esperstar

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase
customer_reviews.text: It blew up in my face electric explosion I inhaled all of the fumes and could have been seriously injured aside from my pinky finger being severely bruised from the top exploding off the canister. The paper shreds inside were burnt and could have caused a serious fire in my apartment. I have a strong electrical burning smell in my apartment and I inhaled it pretty bad since I was standing over the shredder at the time of the explosion. Do not buy this item it is a dangerous hazard.
customer_reviews.author: Foxyfeline99

customer_reviews.title: Perfect option for a small space
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for a small shredder for light use, this one is well-made and fits perfectly on the corner of a desk. The key words are small and light use. Agree with other reviews that the opening is an odd size - an 8-1/2x11 sheet of paper folded in half is just slightly too big to fit. But it works fine for shredding typical mail folded in thirds. For a few pieces of junk mail a day and the occasional credit card, it's great, since the mail comes pre-folded and I can empty the container every few days. But if you have to shred full-size sheets, or a large volume of mail, I would recommend a standard size shredder.
customer_reviews.author: Serena

customer_reviews.title: We received the original shredder. It worked for two ...
customer_reviews.text: We received the original shredder. It worked for two days. We received the replacement and it worked for four despite the fact that I intentionally didn't shred more than one piece of paper at a time. There is no longer a link for me to return it and I can't find anyway to contact customer service to return it or get a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Hinz

customer_reviews.title: 💕 I think I'm in love! 💕
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to help aide a big job I had so I could alternate between machines when one overheated as they all seem to do. However, it NEVER failed or overheated so I didn't need to alternate between this and my other machine. I love that it's a lighter color and not black because it can discretely sit beside my desk and not stick out like a sore thumb. I'm very impressed with the quality and ease of use, it shreds very smoothly. I'm definitely a fan, and I'm going to look to this brand first above other more well known brands on the market in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Sapiosexy Bibliophile

customer_reviews.title: TRY, TRY, TRY AGAIN
customer_reviews.text: I've been in the market for a paper shredder for some time now. This one was cheap, and had good enough reviews to make me pull the trigger. Only problem was, it didn't work. Now normally I would have sent it back, but because of coronavirus, I tinkered with it. The shredder (top part) has a sensor that makes it only work when properly attached to the canister. The way I got it working was wedging a piece of tape in the sensor area. Once it got it running it has been a great little paper shredder.
customer_reviews.author: Mama C

customer_reviews.title: Big enough to do the job but small enough to store out of sight. Wish it cut the paper smaller though.
customer_reviews.text: Cuts a little bigger than I would prefer but this is perfect to keep in our RV when we head south for the winter. I have it in a closet ready to go but out of sight. When you live in an RV you have to get creative about where you put things. it doesn't take much for our small living space to look cluttery. This shredder is big enough to do the job but small enough to keep out of sight.
customer_reviews.author: D. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Faulty Shredder?
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if this was just a faulty shredder or what, but I literally took it out the box, put it together, plugged it up and a few seconds later, it started burning. I smelled a burning smell within 30 sec of plugging it up. I thought maybe it was new and it would wear off, so I put a small piece of paper in it just to test it out. A few seconds after, smoke started to rise from the machine. I unplugged it and sent it back. Be careful.
customer_reviews.author: A. B. Bee

customer_reviews.title: I love this product for the value
customer_reviews.text: I love this product for the value. Of course I wish that it's capacity was a little bigger so that I didn't have to empty it so often, but you get what you pay for! The shredder works great for up to 4 pieces of regular paper, 1 credit card, and several receipts at once. It is pretty powerful for it's size, but definitely gets jammed if you put too much through. I do recommend this shredder for small office or apartment spaces because it doesn't take up very much space and works well for small amounts of shredding!
customer_reviews.author: thegirlyonfire

customer_reviews.title: Only thing was that I had to take breaks for the shredder to cool down which meant I had to unplug and turn ...
customer_reviews.text: I used the shredder this past weekend and I was loading tons of paper to test. Only thing was that I had to take breaks for the shredder to cool down which meant I had to unplug and turn off but after about 10 minutes it was ready to go again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This shredder is supposedly for professional use. doubtful. ...
customer_reviews.text: This shredder is supposedly for professional use. doubtful. You must fold paper only as wide as 8 1/2" X !!" AND it takes only 4 layers of paper through the small opening. Also, the box it arrived in was smashed and poorly taped with the wall plug on the outside of the box; hope it lasts more that 45 min of use. There was no shipping box around the product's box AND there was NO LETTER OPENER 1 Not a particular fave of mine of all the Amazon products I've received.
customer_reviews.author: ANGUS - CHICAGO

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a shredder just for light shredding of mail and such and didn't think i'd find one this small! This one is perfect for me because I can actually leave it behind my computer monitor on my desk when I'm not using it (although this setup is specific to my desk) and then I bring it out when I need it. I've had it for a month or so and used it a few times and so far so good! If it stops working I'll update this.
customer_reviews.author: catherinemorris1125

customer_reviews.title: Well suited for home use
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice little shredder perfect for home use. It does a nice job of shredding and takes up very little space. You just need to be aware that the feed slot is fairly small so an 8.5x11 piece of paper needs to either be folded in quarters or in half lengthwise to go thru. Only 4 paper thickness can go thru at once so it will take a lot longer to shred a lot of papers this size, I try to do some shredding each day so it’s not that bad. If you as directed you will enjoy Handy little item.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy in AZ

customer_reviews.title: Great, till it's not.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this, and it worked great. Until it didn't. It just stopped working one day. It starts to shred when you put a piece of paper in and then stops when it comes into contact with that paper. It reverses just fine. Not sure what happened. I tried one of those sharpening/lubricating scanner sheet and even that did not help. I tried to contact the company but I never got response. Now I am not sure what to do with this item. Seems disappointing to just send it to a landfill.
customer_reviews.author: TPM

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this paper shredder. When I ordered it I had a whole bucket full of papers that needed to be shredded. I had read in some of the reviews that shredder didn’t work long or wore out quickly. I did the whole bucket within a 2 day span just doing a bundle of papers at a time and I didn’t have any issues, even with it being a desk top shredder.
customer_reviews.author: Mary M

customer_reviews.title: Desktop Shredder a Great Value!
customer_reviews.text: There are a few negative reviews that are unwarranted!! It works great and is compact so it fits pretty much anywhere. Keep in mind that this is more for light duty not volume shredding. Because of this, the product is great for home use! I purchased mine for my office at work to get rid of credit card numbers and other sensitive information that I used to collect and then take the large shredder. This is far more efficient (had to lock material up until I could find time to shred) and it's convenient, having it right on my desk! I couldn't be happier with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Fischer

customer_reviews.title: Weak, awkward size, broke in 10 minutes
customer_reviews.text: Smelled like burning and jammed up within 10 minutes of opening the box. Really small. Can't handle more than a sheet at a time, but isn't wide enough for a whole sheet. Confused as to what anyone would be using it for
customer_reviews.author: andy beringer

customer_reviews.title: Good Mini-Sized Shredder
customer_reviews.text: This tiny unit is easily stored, just make sure that you read what the dimensions are prior to ordering. I had pictured this shredder a lot larger in my mind when I ordered it! It does the job and shreds, but make sure you don't put more than 3 or 4 pages at a time. The shredder opening is only about 4 inches wide versus a full sized shredder that is about 8-inches wide! Thank you, Mr. & Mrs. "Jr."
customer_reviews.author: Mr. and Mrs. “Jr”

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Yes it's small, and you have to fold your paper first, personally I don't shred more than 2 sheets at a time... but is perfect for home use (mail, etc) mine did come with a tool. Cuts about 1-1&1/2 inch strips.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Matkin

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love this paper shredder
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this paper shredder. I live in an apartment complex in an urban area and have an irrational fear of my address or information getting out but this paper shredder puts my mind at ease. I never thought that at 23 something of this nature would bring so much calm and ease to my life. It's honestly probably one of the best purchases I've made in the past 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sent a used shredder
customer_reviews.text: Was very disappointed when I got the shredder. The box was taped up like someone returnee it. When I opened it you can tell it was used. Shredded paper fell out of the shredder and there was no manual (not that I needed a manual) I just like to have one. Didn’t even try it out. Only thing I liked was the size.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Not rich enough to buy cheap.
customer_reviews.text: This is cheap and plastic. If you want something sturdy this is not for you. I had some letters to shred it did the job but it was very difficult to use. You need to shred one paper at a time. It takes to shred forever. Better to give that money to a better machine.
customer_reviews.author: Simbel Ayse

customer_reviews.title: Shredder
customer_reviews.text: This is good for the person that may shred a document or two every now and then. This is a tabletop unit so you will be dumping the container a lot cause it can't hold a lot. I used it for primarily junk mail and BILLS!!. It served me well for 2 years and then died when I got a little crazy shredding a bunch of old bills and documents.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Small but powerful!
customer_reviews.text: We live in our RV full time, so I wanted a small, compact shredder. This is just right. I love the cross cut feature that insures privacy. The motor is strong enough for credit cards. Since it is small, the bucket does fill up quickly. Also, due to it's compact size, the paper slot is narrow. This is not a problem for me, but did want to mention that in case it's an issue for someone else. I just tear any full sized sheets (8.5 x 11) lengthwise before feeding them in. I have used this shredder quite a bit since I got it. The motor is still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: DarlaKay

customer_reviews.title: Works fine for me,
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mainly to shred magazines to use as packing for moving and it works great. It's certainly cheap enough, I also shred my junk mail, shredded a bunch of CDs too. I was shredding quite a bit when the red light came on and it stopped due to overheating, but I was shredding one magazine after another, about 5 to 6 pages at a time. Left it alone a little while then went back to shredding. I didn't want to spend a bunch of money on something I will barely use but if you want a cheap unit for casual shredding this is worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Charles J. Hampton-SnowTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Compact but Powerful
customer_reviews.text: This little thing is the bomb of small shredders. I needed a small one for my home office for mostly mail that needed to be shredded and also old credit cards. My previous one quit working and I had hung onto it only because of the pencil sharpener and it never shredded credit cards like this little Aurora. It is perfect. It would exceed perfection if it had a pencil sharpener built in but a girl cannot have it all. LOL. Really I highly recommend for small space. Takes up very little room and its design is appealing for a home office.
customer_reviews.author: Connie D. Hill

customer_reviews.title: Cute and powerful!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this. I live in a tiny apartment and this is perfect to store away until I need it, but it's also small enough that it could easily sit on the corner of a desk for regular use. I've had small shredders in the past that aren't consistent, but this one is. It works every time and is powerful enough to fit all my shredding needs.
customer_reviews.author: Dani

customer_reviews.title: Little Shredder
customer_reviews.text: Good little shredder.. When I first opened the box I had the feeling this had been bought by someone, tried & returned because there were a couple of pieces of paper in the shredder area, but otherwise it looked to be ok.. I tried it & shredded a letter & an old debit card & everything worked ok.. I've decided to keep it although that first impression still troubles me, guess I'm tired of returning things.. But this does the trick for me since I'm not a frequent user of shredders just occasional items.. I recommend this shredder.. 2/23/18 Still loving this little shredder works great for me..
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Nice Desktop shredder!
customer_reviews.text: We needed to replace a desktop shredder we had for years. Honestly, there weren’t a lot of choices. We took a chance on this and have been very happy. It’s a bit smaller than what we had so it takes up less space on the kitchen desk, which is a plus. It is a bit quieter than the one we were replacing plus it shreds faster. We have a regular size shredder in the garage for bigger shredding jobs, but like having this small size in the kitchen for quick mail shredding needs. This met our needs perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Kathi W.

customer_reviews.title: Get that for what you pay
customer_reviews.text: This shredder is just OK. I’ve used it for several hours. It has jammed with normal use. I typically only feed 4-5 pages at a time. I’ve used several shredders in my life and none of them have been able to handle the number of pages for which they claim. This is a strip-cut shredder (long strips of paper) as opposed to a criss-cut (little pieces) shredder, and therefore less secure.
customer_reviews.author: Unknown Dude

customer_reviews.title: Perfect portable shredder!
customer_reviews.text: A great little shredder!! Not too big and works great. Easy to empty, too. I learned that you really need to shred anything with your name and address on it, so i just shred that part of all mail. It was especially useful when my husband recently received a letter from social security with his ENTIRE SS number on it not once but twice!!). Plan to buy as a gift for friends in future!
customer_reviews.author: Patty Alspaugh

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely great buy, love it!!
customer_reviews.text: Love my little shredder, it’s so convenient! Quality is better then expected. I honestly had this item in my cart for days unsure if it’ll be what I wanted it to be... I didn’t want to take my chance getting something that seems cheaply made or that would brake down after a few uses. But it definitely exceeded my expectations, for it to be a small shredder it’s is strong if that makes sense lol. Will deff recommend it it’s a great buy and convenient for small spaces like my small office area! You won’t regret it
customer_reviews.author: Monica G

customer_reviews.title: Be careful of the blades
customer_reviews.text: It’s very Efficient, and the size is perfect for my studio apartment. I also received it earlier than estimated. Very pleased,
customer_reviews.author: LaShunda

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: After reading some reviews, I was skeptical. However, since the price is fairly low, I decided to try it. I really just needed something small that will be able to handle shredding junk mail. After a few minutes, my entire pile had been taking care of! I continue to use it periodically and am still very happy with the results. One thing I will say, make sure to fold papers so they fit in vertically. If you place them in horizontally, the shredder will cut them in lines of text, while vertically results in just random letters.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cross cut
customer_reviews.text: Got this shredder for personal use to dispose bills and anything with my name and stuff on it. You have to fold the paper to fit it in the slot. It won't shred full sheets. Also don't shove a bunch of sheets of paper in the shredder because the engine will start to slow don't and the cut won't be as clean. Make sure to insert the paper so that the words will be cut through, that way you don't end up having tiny shreds of paper with readable words still on them. The shredder isn't too loud but it's not low noise. I'd say it's as loud as blender? Maybe slightly more quiet?
customer_reviews.author: Happy Mask Salesman

customer_reviews.title: Don't over shred!
customer_reviews.text: Lots of fun. I have my kids shred as a chore. Does exactly what you need. Shreds away your life! The only thing I would share is not to attempt to add to many sheets. it took us awhile to get the jammed papers out, but once we did it worked just fine. Even shred right through my credit cards! one at a time of course.
customer_reviews.author: windy

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING
customer_reviews.text: WOW. My mother in law asked me to get her the cheapest shredder I could find and this was it. Although it is small, it's such great quality. She shredded for over two hours with no issues. It was so good in fact that I ordered it for myself too. I get bank and credit card statements electronically because the less paper/mail I have laying around, the better but even then I'll get letters with sensitive information that stacks up over time. Great for every now and again use!
customer_reviews.author: Claudia

customer_reviews.title: NOT/NOT a Cross Cut Shredder; produces strips
customer_reviews.text: This is NOT/NOT a cross cut shredder. It cuts in strips. You can easily reassemble documents with the strips. Pretty bogus on part of Amazon to call this a cross cut shredder. Highly disappointed as I wanted a boba fide cross cut doc shredder.
customer_reviews.author: pod shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: This little thing is great! I almost pulled the trigger on a more expensive one and decided to try this first. Works great and cross cuts! The slot to put paper in is not letter size, so you just have to fold some pieces a bit. Other than that it's a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Sheri O'Brien

customer_reviews.title: GREAT LITTLE SHREDDER
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little shredder although it only takes 3-4 sheets of paper at a time or it grinds to a halt. The shreds do get stuck to the blades, so it is imperative to unplug the shredder before lifting the top and pulling the stuck shreds off. The wastebasket into which the shreds collect is not very large. I usually put a trash bag into the empty wastebasket so that I only need to unplug the shredder, lift off the top, and remove the shreds.
customer_reviews.author: kandrues53

customer_reviews.title: Too small to use easily
customer_reviews.text: I bought this shredder a few years back to help me get rid of my junk mail and other papers with personal information on them. I mean, it worked fine, but I didn't like that the slot was so small I had to fold most things. It was fine for standard letter size paper folded in thirds, but most credit card stuff wasn't that size so I spent a lot of time folding things to fit. The capacity was also small so I had to keep emptying the bin. It did at least shred things properly? In the end, after less than 4 years of use it totally jammed and I have to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Becky H.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little shredder!
customer_reviews.text: Since the pandemic, cat litter has been hard to find in my area. When I can find it, I use half of the litter and half shredded paper. I didn't need a huge shredder and this one is perfect and small enough to store in the closet. It shreds really well and I shall also be using it to shred items that have personal information on it. We have a recycle program here in my city but I don't like to leave certain paper items out on the curb, now I don't have to worry my nifty little shredder will take care of the shredding!
customer_reviews.author: WLLC

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for small home use.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size - fits nicely next to my desk on top of my computer tower. My cat is fascinated by it, too. He already learned how to turn it on!! UGH! The only complaint is that it does fill fast & the blades clog up. Not to the point of not shredding, but when I empty the basket I have to clean out the blades too. It comes with a little blade cleaner - I don't really use much. I LOVE the safety feature that it will not shred unless it is seated properly on the basket. Great for when I empty it & forget to turn it to OFF 1st :D
customer_reviews.author: SassyLass

customer_reviews.title: Won’t last long
customer_reviews.text: This paper shredder is so poorly made and the paper gets caught in the grinder after you use it for five minutes.When you try to do 5 pages at a time it catches unto the shredder and you have to keep reversing it to get the paper to go through.On top of that the bin fills up very quick and if you don’t dump it you won’t be able to shred any papers.I hate that I threw away my box unless I would’ve returned it!
customer_reviews.author: Shirley Davis

customer_reviews.title: good enough
customer_reviews.text: this is a very good design. i have went through about 5 shredders because i always get in a hurry and put too many pages in at the same time and burn it up. this one is impossible to put too many in and two months later it is still working! you can only put one or two pages, folded in half at a time so there is no way to over load it.. works really good and does an excellent size shredded product..
customer_reviews.author: dodybe

customer_reviews.title: Love this little machine!
customer_reviews.text: Other than having to empty it too often this is the perfect size for our RV! It works just like the big boys only a little slower due to having to feed it one page ay a time. But for people like us who have limited space, this is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Sherri

customer_reviews.title: FALSELY ADVERTISED!! not cross cut.
customer_reviews.text: This product does not cross cut as advertised! I bought the shredder a few months ago to replace a similar model I had that cut lengthwise only. I thought I made a purchasing error so I kept the shredder. Only realized today (after reviewing my orders) that it was advertised as cross cutting. I think Amazon should rectify this purchase by sending me the cross cutting version so I can return this one. Very disappointed when I realized that I hadn't made a purchase error. The product was falsely advertised as cross cutting!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job Well.
customer_reviews.text: It tends to clog easily and overheated frequently during my constant use, but it was perfect for shredding dozens and dozens of pieces of junk mail. It comes with a little plastic stick which was very helpful for unclogging it.
customer_reviews.author: DarcieMae1121

customer_reviews.title: Takes a lickin' Keeps on tickin'
customer_reviews.text: I put this poor thing through a lot. I shredded two years' worth of junk mail for a friend in one sitting, and I use it almost daily for my home office. I've managed to overheat it a couple of times, and I once stuffed in about twice the recommended thickness. But it always manages to bounce back despite my abuse. This is not a fancy cross-cut shredder that you'd use to prevent corporate espionage or hide documents from the IRS, but the cuts are fine enough to thwart your average would-be identity thief scouring your trash for pre-approved credit card notices. If you need a decent, hardworking shredder on the cheap, here's your guy.
customer_reviews.author: Christy Dunaway

customer_reviews.title: Broken first day of use
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a gift for my 87 year old mother. She used it today and it worked fine. When she used it later in the day it only shred on one side. I went over there and cleared every tiny shred of paper and followed everything the manual said to do yet there is something that appears to be metal on the left side of Center and it prevents full shredding. It will shred if papers are cut in half. I think I will have to return or replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for home use
customer_reviews.text: This has lasted for years... and still going strong! It's compact and good for just personal home use. I don't use it daily, but maybe once a week. It can cut credit cards too. It will jam if you put too much paper in (like three sheets at the same time), and you shouldn't put anything with stickers (like labels on envelopes) or that causes the teeth to get stuck. If it does jam, just pull the paper out of the teeth from the other side, or hit the "reverse" button.
customer_reviews.author: MeeY

customer_reviews.title: Works great for small needs
customer_reviews.text: I needed just a small shredder that would not take up a lot of space in my small home office. Here's the deal -- a standard 8.5 x 11 piece of paper does not fit. Even if I fold in half, it does not fit. I fold the half page in half and stick that in the shredder and it works great! Read the instructions. Empty the basket frequently. For someone who just has a few pages to shred each day it is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Havis

customer_reviews.title: Excellent little shredder
customer_reviews.text: I really did not want a wastebasket sized shredder. This one is the perfect size! It can sit on a desk or on a shelf. It's very quiet too. The shredder we previously had could be heard across the house when in use. This one is much quieter. It shreds a good amount of paper at a time and shreds credit cards nicely as well. It even has a nice little handle to lift the shredder off of the basket.
customer_reviews.author: J. G.

customer_reviews.title: Desk shredder
customer_reviews.text: This is a small shredder. I have a large computer desk and I have this shredder sitting on my desk. It is fantastic and comes with its own little waste basket. It is a cross cutter and thank you to whomever thought of making a desk top shredder as I have really put this one to use.
customer_reviews.author: BettyJoyce

customer_reviews.title: I don't miss the shredder in the office anymore
customer_reviews.text: Since COVID19, and not going into the office anymore, I haven't been able to shred all of the junk mail I get. Usually, I don't care but lately, I've been getting more and more credit card offers. This is small enough to sit on my counter, shred what I need, dump it, and it stores neatly, out of the way. This is definitely worth it! It doesn't hold a lot but it is easy to dump and keep shredding.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Received a used unit
customer_reviews.text: It appears to be a good shredder but I received a used unit. There was pieces of shredded paper in the bin and there are scratches all over ... but I paid the full price. It’s not honest!
customer_reviews.author: J.H.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome compact device
customer_reviews.text: I love this! I didn't know paper shredders existed in this small of a size until I found this one. I wouldn't recommend it if you do a lot of shredding regularly as the bin is pretty small but if you need something for occasional use, this is perfect and it doesn't take up much space. It is pretty tough too. I have used it to shred a bunch of stuff and it handled it like a champ. Just had to keep emptying it a lot and not put too much through it at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Good small shredder
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this awhile ago. I like the size of this shredder. I occasionally use it to shred mail and receipts. It was able to shred my expired credit card too. It doesn’t use up a lot of space and it gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: CHRISTINA

customer_reviews.title: Love it! But can be messy...
customer_reviews.text: This works as stated! Paper.. credit cards. Just follow the rules. It has been great! No more security concerns involving my mail. No jams yet.. haven't needed to use the included tool. Do be careful though when carrying around the house. I keep thinking the lid has a handle which makes an awful mess when it falls off off and these perfectly diced strips go everywhere. Thank goodness for vacuums! Just hold from bottom and it's great! Oh and it's not too loud, but not quiet either. Overall, wonderful product!
customer_reviews.author: Peach

customer_reviews.title: Great Shredder
customer_reviews.text: This is small, but not tiny. Motor is strong. It cut my credit card, but I did that just to test it, and I won't be doing that again. It's just me, because I tend to "baby" my stuff. You can have it turned on all the time, or just turn it on for a short job, or turn it off. When it's on, a green light comes on to let you know it's on, even if you have it on for only a short job and forget to turn it off. Besides great performance, I like how it looks, not ugly like other shredders. Not a nice shredder ....... a great shredder!
customer_reviews.author: C&H

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: This shredder is perfect for the house. I like shredding my mail to make sure the occasional trash diggers don’t steal any info and this is perfect. It’s large enough for 8x11 and it’s POWERFUL, credit card shredder works well too, haven’t tried a cd not sure I will ever need to. Also though it’s sleek enough to be out of the way and unseen. Love that it’s a lighter color as my entire room is pure white and grey. I love it. And the price?!!! Cant be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda E. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great desktop shredder
customer_reviews.text: Adding to my makeshift covid home office with this desktop shredder. Works great and takes up very little room. I just got today and only used once for the big pile of papers I had accumulated. Went through them all perfectly. It is a small unit so you can't cram in a lot of papers but for my work from home needs, its just fine. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: JLS

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT for its PURPOSE!
customer_reviews.text: I love this little shredder! I’ve had it for a few months now and it is perfect for my purpose! I have it next to my front door and the junk mail no longer makes it any further! It isn't the best for large jobs, but that’s not what it is meant for and it didn’t give up when I did use it for my first large purge. I did have to let it cool down a few times, but again, that’s NOT it’s purpose! ( It is absolutely PERFECT for its purpose!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecka

customer_reviews.title: Powerful little machine!
customer_reviews.text: This powerful little shredder is great for home and desk top use. It will go through credit cards and multiple sheets. Easy to clean and a wonderful tool for the money. I love it so much, I bought for all my children, as well!
customer_reviews.author: kgkrost

customer_reviews.title: Simple & Great
customer_reviews.text: Cute little paper shredder. I bought it for a big move, and I have a habit of keeping all correspondence until the very last minute. This paper shredder was able to handle 2 years’ worth of mail and other things without a problem. Of course you will have to pre-fold or rip apart certain things before shredding because of its size. That’s not really a problem for me though because I wanted something simple and compact.
customer_reviews.author: Louise Vidanes

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for travel.
customer_reviews.text: I have a full-size Fellowes shredder at home but I’m away from there for several months each year. This little beast does a great job of crosscut shredding personal information while away from home. It’s small, relatively light and rugged. Yes, you need to fold full-size pages or tear them in half lengthwise, but the shredder will easily handle a four-layer thickness. I caught it at $25 and that’s a bargain for what it does.
customer_reviews.author: David K. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Mini Shredder
customer_reviews.text: It's a lot smaller than I expected. Very small size does not take up space. Letter paper needs to be folded in half before it can be used. I think it is only used for the home office.
customer_reviews.author: Jason.tsui

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend for small batches!!
customer_reviews.text: This little machine works like a charm. Works well for daily shredding. Would not recommend for large catch up shredding. I would find a community free shred day for that. Works well with cards and regular mail. Would recommend for small batches!!
customer_reviews.author: "mikamiranda"

customer_reviews.title: Shedder is adequate at best
customer_reviews.text: This shredder is terrible, will not handle household usage without choking. Shredding of paper produces larger than expected shred and folding two 8x11 sheets in half to shred causes the shredder to almost stop dead, it struggles to get through the paper. Motor is just not strong enough to handle more than a single 8x11 sheet folder in half to fit the opening. Nice recessed handle makes is easy to empty the bin. If you leave the shredder in standby the bright green light is annoying, do not think the light pollution is worth the green light. Seems to struggle to shred a single credit card, almost to the point of jamming. Adequate, but would not purchase again or recommend.
customer_reviews.author: P. Catchpole

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Last One Week
customer_reviews.text: This didn't last one week. I fed it half of the maximum amount of paper the manufacturer suggested and it jammed instantly. There's a "feature" on the shredder that says it assists in clearing jams, it doesn't. The worst part is that when the shredder jams it will still feed so the paper will be forced into the only open side of the shredder, jamming that side. I was very careful and never overfed the shredder and it jammed over and over. Don't waste your money, this is the worst purchase I've ever made on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: ACinKC

customer_reviews.title: Great size
customer_reviews.text: I shopped around a lot for a shredder because most were too big. I work from home and only occasionally need to shred documents and usually I can tear off the sensitive parts. I after to say that I ordered this once and what arrived did not work. I don't know why. I returned it and shopped around in stores and online, but this model really was what I wanted and its working well.
customer_reviews.author: E Beatty

customer_reviews.title: I like the compact size
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this shredder a year and a half ago, and it is still working well. I like the compact size, and it is easy to clean. The opening is on the smaller side- a little wider than a standard envelope- but it has worked well for me as I mainly shred mail.
customer_reviews.author: JDP75

customer_reviews.title: Great little shredder
customer_reviews.text: You will have to fold sheets of paper in half lengthwise but it works great. I wanted one that wouldn’t take up too much space and that would work for junk mail. Perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Just right for a desk or small space
customer_reviews.text: This shredder is just the right size for my office. It fits nicely on my desk. It's quiet (not silent of course). It's perfect for shredding mail and the opening is wider than an envelope and can handle an 8x10 document if it's folded. I know I'm happy with this purchase. it's just a paper shredder, but it looks good, and I like that it's unique.
customer_reviews.author: Shazam

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Great little shredder for shredding small mail items. We use it for shredding unwanted mail that arrives that may contain bits of personal information. Compact enough to fit out of site in the kitchen where the mail comes in. Does a great job of shredding in to tiny pieces. Handles credit cards easily too!!
customer_reviews.author: J. M.

customer_reviews.title: Really good, wish it was a tad bit wider
customer_reviews.text: This thing sits so perfectly on my desk, and takes care of most shredding that I need. Easy to pop the top off and empty, and it comes with something to empty out the teeth for pieces when they get stuck. The only thing is that the slot is a bit narrow. If you want to put in a piece of paper, you need to fold it in half. Not huge, but a little thing that irritates.
customer_reviews.author: Gary B

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love this!
customer_reviews.text: I always hate having a pile of mail to shred, it honestly stresses me out to see a pile of junk in my kitchen, so having this has been AMAZING! I can shred mail/receipts when I need to and it fits perfectly on the kitchen desk. It shreds really well and is surprisingly strong considering it’s size -but it does struggle a bit if u do 3-4 pages, which doesn’t bother me too much given how convenient it is.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Compact and powerful
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a similar product that Staples sells, and this one seems actually much more powerful and also of better quality. It's a bit more expensive, but I hope it's worth the money. So far, I love the features, such as the easy to empty waste drawer and the power buttons. I use it almost every day.
customer_reviews.author: erudy

customer_reviews.title: Works Just Fine
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Cross-Cut Paper cutter because I was going away from home for 2 months and wanted something portable and adequate enough to shred receipts, credit card statements, and other documents I didn't just want to just throw in the trash. It fits that purpose very well. Granted, it is not designed to do volume shredding but at that price, it's all you'll need for miscellaneous and periodic shredding. I would buy it again and recommend it for low volume shredding requirements.
customer_reviews.author: David In NJ

customer_reviews.title: I would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.text: It does its job and does it well. Please note, however, that the shredding capacity (four sheets) and the width of the opening means that you will most likely find yourself shredding two sheets at a time folded lengthwise or four sheets torn in half if you are using it on normal sized papers. As long as that is not a problem for you, which it's not for me, I would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: givens

customer_reviews.title: Compact
customer_reviews.text: It is not meant for lots of usage. It only shreds really 2 sheets at a time or it will get jam. When it gets jam it is challenging to clean it out (unplug first). Also it small; thus, it fills up very quickly amend when it fills up to the rim, it starts popping the top off causing shreds to come out. The good it is very compact.
customer_reviews.author: Urban Gal

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: I've had a similar shredder in the past that worked so much better. This one after only 5 minutes stopped working, lighting a red bulb saying that it's overheated and I need to wait 15 minutes to operate it again. The shredding wasn't easy no smooth. Is never recommend this shredder to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Deedee

customer_reviews.title: Cute and Efficient!
customer_reviews.text: This is a neat, efficient machine IF you follow the instructions correctly. It's the only way to keep this machine working well and without problems. Most importantly, keep sticky/sealant areas, as in envelope sealing flaps, away from it as well as any other type of sticky sealant areas. I simply tear those things up. Ex. Catalogs have envelopes with a sticky flap to seal it stapled in the middle of it with the customer name on them. With this shredder, I have to be more mindful of sorting what can be shredded vs. what can't. Another plus is that it takes up less space. It's perfect for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: D. E. Arthur

customer_reviews.title: buyer beware, seriously.
customer_reviews.text: take the bad reviews seriously. I'm one day over my return window,I just tore up the box, and it quit working. motor does not come on. I'm not over here shredding phone books daily. just bills and junk mail, here and there. one month, is all it gave me. buy with caution. it's cheap, I get that. but should've lasted longer than a month.
customer_reviews.author: maggie

customer_reviews.title: junk
customer_reviews.text: Can't even do a bill from the mail without getting backed up. It now has the last 1/2in of an envelope trapped in it's blades. Overheats and shuts off constantly can't even do the days mail without it over heating. I don't understand what is is for if you can't shread the contents of a couple credit card offers and a bill without it overheating. trash plain and simple.
customer_reviews.author: PinkMelody

customer_reviews.title: The Best Shredder! Very high quality.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent shredder, have used it constantly since purchasing it, some days I’ve used it nonstop, cleaning out old files. It’s definitely the best shredder I’ve ever had. I’ve gone through 2 others in the past year. Just wish it was bigger since I use it a lot more than I anticipated.
customer_reviews.author: Movielover54

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Shredder
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this shredder because I wanted a counter top version that could stay out all the time and blends into the decor. This one is perfect. Compact but very powerful. I open my mail and am able to shred it right away. Excellent machine.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: A good little shredder
customer_reviews.text: A good little shredder. It does tend to jam a bit when the bin starts to fill up (which happens very quickly), but that is the price you pay for the small size unit. If you're looking for a small cross cut shredder for light or infrequent shredding this is your product. It can handle bigger jobs, but that requires patience, as it only accepts 4 sheets at a time, and all sheets must tri-folded or folded in half to fit in the slot.
customer_reviews.author: gam88

customer_reviews.title: Too small.  The instructions are wrong.  It jams easily.
customer_reviews.text: I love how small and compact this is. Great fir small spaces. Don’t try to shred as much as they instructions say. It jams bad!!! If you shred everything like I do this is not for you. Once again I have been taken. It does not do what it says. Waste of money. Yes it cheap. It is very small.
customer_reviews.author: kitty64

customer_reviews.title: For small shredding-2pcs paper max. Still good deal!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use at home to shred mail. its worth it but you cant put more than 2pcs paper at a time or it will get stuck. Cleaning out the grate after use is tricky because lots of bits paper get stuck. But if you dont mind spending few extra mins to clean it after using- this is a great product
customer_reviews.author: S.

customer_reviews.title: Cuts big but worth the cost
customer_reviews.text: This shredder is working great so far but it does not cut the pages as small as I would like them to be. Overall for the price though it was very well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Suzy Spriggs

customer_reviews.title: Not for regular size paper.
customer_reviews.text: Good table top shredder. Little disappointed in have to cut regular size paper in half before you feed into the shredder.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, small, shreds a few pages well. Perfect for a home office
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what it says. Cheap, small shredder. Only handles a few pages at a time, but if you're buying this it's because you only need to shred a little. I've had it for 4 months, used it a few times, no problems. The trash can it sits on is not attached, so be careful of dumping out all your shreddings. Also the cleaning metal pick for the teeth is just sitting in the side pocket, so be careful not to lose that either.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: It gets the job done but you better not put more then three folder pieces of paper in there or it will jam and unjamming it is nearly impossible. It’s very small and compact which is good for small spaces but it can’t take on much paper at one time. So it’s a compromise for the smaller size.
customer_reviews.author: Deedra

customer_reviews.title: It's Okay
customer_reviews.text: It does the job if, like me, you need shredded only about a half dozen to a dozen documents per day. Why only that? Because the average page won't fit in the slot and you have to fold it in half lengthwise. That means you can only shred two average pages at a time. The individual shredding operation is fast, a little noisy, and the shredded paper catcher easily separates from the machine. I would give it a higher rating if the slot were wider. It is good for small operations; but, in my opinion, not for medium ones unless you have too much time on your hands.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Bear

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised, though it struggles a bit.
customer_reviews.text: The reservoir holds VERY little, and you won't get paper in here unless it's tri-folded letter style. It also won't take more than a couple sheets at a time without making you feel bad with pathetic sounds. It does indeed manage to shred credit cards, but again, only with vocal complaints. If you actually have enough shred-worthy correspondence coming in that you need a shredder around, you should consider giving this a pass and picking up something slightly more pricey but a lot more... reality-sized. This is not a bad appliance -- it continues to work for me, however labored it sounds -- but it is underpowered and generally ill-prepared for the task expected of it.
customer_reviews.author: Trepidation

customer_reviews.title: OK for light use
customer_reviews.text: This shredder is fine for light home use, but paper twists and jams easily if there is paper building up in the basket. If empty fine. Bottom line, light occasional shredding worth the money for sure. If you have a lot of shredding, empty the basket frequently to prevent issues or invest in a higher end shredder.
customer_reviews.author: Ohio

customer_reviews.title: A Handy Little Shredder for Light to Medium Shredding
customer_reviews.text: I like using this shredder for daily junk mail shredding. It cuts very well so that no one can tell what information was shredded. It is fairly quiet compared to others. The container bin is quite small and fills up quickly so if you have a lot of shredding to do, you have to empty it often. I like the little tool for clearing the cutters that was included.
customer_reviews.author: Dee Bee

product_meta.title: Aurora AS420C Desktop-Style Cross-Cut Paper Shredder
product_meta.description:
Style:AS420CAurora 4-sheet Cross Cut Paper and Credit Card Shredder with Translucent Wastebasket.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


 Destroy sensitive information with this compact desktop paper shredder, designed for economical document security. Durable steel cutters destroy documents into confetti, shredding up to four-folded sheets of paper or one credit card per pass. AS420C features convenient handle design for easy lifting, a letter opener, and detachable power cord; this shredder is ideal for any home office environment.

SHREDDER SPECIFICATIONS
 *  Light duty compact design, ideal for countertop or home/small office 
 *  Shreds up to 4-folded sheets of 20 lb. bond paper, one Credit Card per pass 
 *  Shred size: 1/5 inch x 1 17/20 inch confetti style pieces 
 *  Wastebasket volume: 1.32 gallon see-through basket (about 40 sheets) 
 *  Durable steel cutters 
 *  4.5-inch wide paper feed entry 

SAFE AND EASY TO USE
 *  Three-mode power switch (Auto/On, Off, Reverse)
 *  Bright power (standby) status indicator light
 *  Auto start / Manual reverse
 *  Thermal protection regulates machine from overheating 

 *  Convenient single-hand lifting handle design allows for easy waste emptying 
 *  Detachable power cord 
 *  Includes letter opener accessory 

WHAT’S IN THE BOX
AS420C desktop shredder, integrated wastebasket, and operations manual. 

Compare Aurora Models

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars2,654 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
